è¯¥æ¼æ´çš„å®‰å…¨é£é™©è¾ƒé«˜ï¼Œå› ä¸ºå®ƒå…è®¸æœªç»èº«ä»½éªŒè¯çš„æ”»å‡»è€…è¿œç¨‹è®¿é—®æ•æ„Ÿä¿¡æ¯æˆ–æ‰§è¡Œæœªæˆæƒæ“ä½œï¼Œå¯èƒ½å¯¼è‡´æ•°æ®æ³„éœ²ã€æœåŠ¡é…ç½®è¢«ç¯¡æ”¹æˆ–å…¶ä»–æ¶æ„æ´»åŠ¨ã€‚ç”±äºæ— éœ€è®¤è¯å³å¯åˆ©ç”¨ï¼Œè¯¥æ¼æ´å¯ä»¥è¢«è‡ªåŠ¨åŒ–å·¥å…·å¤§è§„æ¨¡æ‰«æå’Œåˆ©ç”¨ï¼Œå¯¹å—å½±å“ç³»ç»Ÿæ„æˆä¸¥é‡å¨èƒã€‚ç‰¹åˆ«æ˜¯å¯¹äºé‚£äº›æœªåŠæ—¶æ›´æ–°åˆ°v0.14.1åŠä»¥ä¸Šç‰ˆæœ¬çš„MCP Inspectorå®ä¾‹ï¼Œé£é™©å°¤ä¸ºçªå‡ºã€‚

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š MCP Inspector

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š version < v0.14.1

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/ashiqrehan-21/MCP-Inspector-CVE-2025-49596

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • Checking_vuln.png
  • Inspector_run.png
  • MCP-Inspector-vulncheck.py
  • readme.txt

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

MCP Inspector CVE-2025-49596 Vulnerability Checker

This script checks if an MCP Inspector server is vulnerable to CVE-2025-49596, a security issue where the /sse endpoint responds to unauthenticated requests (missing auth token).

How It Works

  • The script sends a GET request to the /sse endpoint of the target MCP Inspector server.
  • It checks the response:
    • If the server responds with HTTP 200 (OK) without requiring an auth token, it is likely vulnerable.
    • If the server responds with HTTP 401 (Unauthorized), it is likely patched (v0.14.1+).
    • Other responses are reported as unexpected.

Requirements

  • Python 3.x
  • requests library (pip install requests)

Usage

Run the script from the command line:

python MCP-Inspector-vulncheck.py [host]
  • host (optional): The hostname or IP address of the MCP Inspector server (default: localhost).
  • The script assumes the server is running on port 6277. To check a different port, edit the script and change the port parameter in check_mcp_inspector().

Examples

Check the local machine (default):

python MCP-Inspector-vulncheck.py

Check a remote host:

python MCP-Inspector-vulncheck.py 192.168.1.100

What to Look For

  • [+] MCP Inspector responded without auth token! â€” The server is likely vulnerable to CVE-2025-49596.
  • [-] Auth token required. Likely patched version (v0.14.1+). â€” The server is not vulnerable.
  • Other errors indicate connection issues or unexpected responses.

Disclaimer

This script is for security testing and educational purposes only. Do not use it on systems you do not own or have explicit permission to test.

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š å—å½±å“äº§å“: Sudoæ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªåœ¨Linuxå’ŒUnix-likeæ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿä¸­å¹¿æ³›ä½¿ç”¨çš„ç¨‹åºï¼Œå…è®¸ç”¨æˆ·ä»¥å…¶ä»–ç”¨æˆ·çš„æƒé™è¿è¡Œç¨‹åºï¼Œé€šå¸¸æ˜¯è¶…çº§ç”¨æˆ·ï¼ˆrootï¼‰ã€‚å®ƒæ˜¯ç³»ç»Ÿç®¡ç†å‘˜å’Œæ™®é€šç”¨æˆ·æ—¥å¸¸æ“ä½œä¸­ä¸å¯æˆ–ç¼ºçš„å·¥å…·ï¼Œéƒ¨ç½²åœ¨å‡ ä¹æ‰€æœ‰çš„LinuxæœåŠ¡å™¨å’Œå·¥ä½œç«™ä¸Šã€‚

æ¼æ´è§£é‡Š: CVE-2025-32462æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªæœ¬åœ°æƒé™æå‡æ¼æ´ï¼Œå­˜åœ¨äºSudoçš„hosté€‰é¡¹ï¼ˆ-hæˆ–--hostï¼‰ä¸­ã€‚è¯¥æ¼æ´å…è®¸æœ¬åœ°ç”¨æˆ·ç»•è¿‡sudoersæ–‡ä»¶ä¸­çš„ä¸»æœºåé™åˆ¶ï¼Œä»è€Œåœ¨éé¢„æœŸçš„æœºå™¨ä¸Šæ‰§è¡Œå‘½ä»¤ï¼Œå¯èƒ½å¯¼è‡´æƒé™æå‡è‡³rootã€‚è¿™ä¸€æ¼æ´çš„æŠ€æœ¯æ ¹æºåœ¨äºSudoåœ¨å¤„ç†hosté€‰é¡¹æ—¶çš„é€»è¾‘é”™è¯¯ï¼Œä½¿å¾—æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥ç»•è¿‡åŸºäºä¸»æœºåçš„è®¿é—®æ§åˆ¶ã€‚

å½±å“åˆ†æ: æ”»å‡»è€…åˆ©ç”¨æ­¤æ¼æ´å¯ä»¥åœ¨å—å½±å“çš„ç³»ç»Ÿä¸Šæ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„å‘½ä»¤ï¼Œå¯èƒ½å¯¼è‡´ç³»ç»Ÿå®Œå…¨è¢«æ§åˆ¶ã€‚ç”±äºè¿™æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªæœ¬åœ°æ¼æ´ï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…éœ€è¦å…ˆè·å¾—å¯¹ç³»ç»Ÿçš„ä½æƒé™è®¿é—®ã€‚ç„¶è€Œï¼Œåœ¨é…ç½®äº†åŸºäºä¸»æœºåçš„sudoersè§„åˆ™çš„ç¯å¢ƒä¸­ï¼Œå°¤å…¶æ˜¯é‚£äº›ä½¿ç”¨é›†ä¸­å¼sudoersæ–‡ä»¶æˆ–LDAPé…ç½®çš„ç¯å¢ƒä¸­ï¼Œè¿™ä¸€æ¼æ´çš„é£é™©å°¤ä¸ºçªå‡ºã€‚å°½ç®¡CVSSè¯„åˆ†ä¸º2.8ï¼ˆä½å±ï¼‰ï¼Œä½†åœ¨ç‰¹å®šé…ç½®ä¸‹ï¼Œå…¶å®é™…å½±å“å¯èƒ½æ›´ä¸ºä¸¥é‡ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š sudo

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š sudo

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 1.8.8 <= version <= 1.9.17

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/atomicjjbod/CVE-2025-32462

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2025:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • README.md
  • exploit

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

CVE-2025-32462

Local Privilege Escalation via Sudo Host Option in Linux

Vulnerability Summary

CVE-2025-32462 is a local privilege escalation vulnerability in the Sudo binary, specifically in the host (-h or --host) option. The flaw allows a local user to bypass hostname restrictions in the sudoers file, enabling execution of commands on unintended machines, potentially escalating privileges to root. The issue was discovered by Rich Mirch of the Stratascale Cyber Research Unit. This vulnerability has been present in Sudoâ€™s code for over 12 years.

  • CVE-ID: CVE-2025-32462
  • Component: sudo
  • Type: Local Privilege Escalation (EoP)
  • CVSS Score: 2.8 (Low)
  • Discovered by: Rich Mirch

Impact

An attacker with low privileges can exploit this vulnerability to execute commands as root on systems where sudoers rules are restricted to specific hostnames or patterns, particularly in environments using centralized sudoers files or LDAP-based configurations. This can lead to complete system compromise.

Exploit

Affected Versions

  • Vulnerable: Sudo 1.8.8 to 1.9.17
  • Patched: Sudo 1.9.17p1 and later
  • Not affected: Versions prior to 1.8.8 (host option behavior not vulnerable)

Mitigation

  • Update sudo to version 1.9.17p1 or later to patch the vulnerability.
  • Avoid using host-specific rules in sudoers files unless necessary, and prefer the ALL keyword for host fields to prevent bypass.
  • Use security frameworks like AppArmor or SELinux to restrict sudo behavior.
  • Audit sudoers configurations, especially in environments with centralized or LDAP-based sudoers files, to identify and remove host-specific rules.
  • Monitor for abnormal sudo invocations, such as unusual -h option usage.

entry.title: n8n Vulnerable to Denial of Service via Malformed Binary Data Requests
entry.content:
é“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pr9r-gxgp-9rm8

ä»“åº“ Starï¼š 114596

CVSS è¯„åˆ†ï¼š 4.9

å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š

  • https://github.com/n8n-io/n8n/security/advisories/GHSA-pr9r-gxgp-9rm8

  • https://github.com/n8n-io/n8n/pull/16229

  • https://github.com/n8n-io/n8n/commit/43c52a8b4f844e91b02e3cc9df92826a2d7b6052

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pr9r-gxgp-9rm8

æè¿°ï¼š

Summary

Denial of Service vulnerability in /rest/binary-data endpoint when processing empty filesystem URIs (filesystem:// or filesystem-v2://).

Impact

This is a Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability that allows authenticated attackers to cause service unavailability through malformed filesystem URI requests. The vulnerability affects:

  • The /rest/binary-data endpoint
  • n8n.cloud instances (confirmed HTTP/2 524 timeout responses)

Attackers can exploit this by sending GET requests with empty filesystem URIs (filesystem:// or filesystem-v2://) to the /rest/binary-data endpoint, causing resource exhaustion and service disruption.

Patches

The issue has been patched in 1.99.0.
All users should upgrade to this version or later.

The fix introduces strict checking of URI patterns.

Patch commit: https://github.com/n8n-io/n8n/pull/16229
